Cauliflower and its effects on breast cancer

Summary generated using: $shovel3 query.concatConclusions 'breast cancer cauliflower site:ncbi.nlm.nih.gov' 40 includeReference=True
  • Our results suggest a modestly elevated risk of breast cancer after longer periods of rotating night work. Additional studies are warranted to rule out small sample size or uncontrolled sources for confounding as alternative explanations.
    • Journal:
    • Date:
    • Link to article
  • These results, particularly that obtained in nontumorigenic/immortalized MCF10A cells, suggest that chemopreventive activity of cabbage against breast cancer observed in epidemiological studies may be partly explained by inhibition of the aromatase expression.
